intro: Lepyronia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky blue or purple flowers that resemble holly berries, hence its common name. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their salt tolerance. Lepyronia species have lance-shaped leaves and often grow in dense clusters, forming low shrubs. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
